alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Halifax County through 600 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Roanoke Rapids, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Weldon, Rosemary, South Weldon and Roanoke Rapids Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
